title: Ecotoons

abstract: In the beginning (dir. Simon Clarke)--Soap (dir. Sandra Ensby)--Desertification = Desertificazione (dir. Fusako Yasaki)--Save energy = Risparmio energetico (dir. Fusako Yasaki)--Urban madness = Urbanistica impazzite (dir. Fusako Yasaki)--Toxic time bomb (dir. Andy Farago)--Bathing impossible = Balneazione imppossible (dir. Fusako Yasaki)--Extinct species = Specie in estinzione (dir. Fusako Yasaki)--Who's pulling the wool over your eyes? (dirs Filipe Alcoda, Seema Keswani, Liz Bernard, Emma Linford, Jo Stedman)--Avoiding the issue (dirs Mark Jones, Andrew Gent, Craig Hepburn, Emma Nicol, Sam Symonds)--Revenge of the trees (dir. Guido Manuli)--The Danger above (dir. Guido Manuli)--Parasites (dir. Simon Cornish)--Return to sender (dir. Guido Manuli)--The Last drop (dir. Sharon Clark)--Business lunch (dir. Beverley Isaacs)--Hotel earth (dir. Guido Manuli)--Time is running out (dir. Guido Manuli)--Recycle/Morph--A Different point of view (dir. Sophie Kyriacou)--Dreamtime (dir. Christopher Scott)--Recycle (dir. Nicola Sudall)--Stop that car! (dir. Bruno Bozzetto)--Pack it in! (dir. Bruno Bozzetto)--It's not quite magic (dir. Louise Kenyon)--Knot the tap! (dir. Bruno Bozzetto)--A Big development (dir. Sophia Lynch)--Seeing the light (dir. Bruno Bozzetto)--Heater cheater (dir. Bruno Bozzetto)--Blowing it all away (dir. Fiona Gomez)
description: Presented by Tony Robinson (Blackadder's Baldrick), this World Wildlife Fund compilation of 30 international animated shorts is aimed at increasing awareness of environmental issues. Using claymation, stop start animation and computer animation, the tales cover a variety of issues such as pollution, overdevelopment, water and energy conservation, the dumping of toxic waste, recycling, logging, extinction and the depletion of the ozone layer. Also includes footage from the BBC series "Going live" in which a 12 year old viewer won a competition to have her storyboard for a "Morph" episode with a "green" theme brought to animated life by the Aardman studios. She visits Peter Lord at the studios who explains the animation process.
